title: How to Redeem Oregon Bottle Deposits Using BottleDrop

steps.headline: Go to https://www.bottledropcenters.com/Locations and find a redemption center or an express location near you.
steps.description: This is the official website of the sole service provider designated by the State of Oregon. You can skip to step 7 if you already have a BottleDrop account card.

steps.headline: Click on the location you intend to use.
steps.description: Make sure that description says this location supports account creation. All redemption centers and most Express locations support it.

steps.headline: Go to the location you selected.
steps.description: You can bring your stash of cans and bottles from home if you want to get rid of them during the same visit.

steps.headline: Find a BottleDrop kiosk inside the store.
steps.description: It is usually located in one of the entryways of the store together with self-serve video rental, vending machines and ATMs.

steps.headline: Push the new account button on the screen and follow the prompts.
steps.description: It will ask you to scan your driver's license barcode, and add contact information. Follow the on-screen instructions.

steps.headline: Set up your PIN.
steps.description: Once complete, the machine will dispense a card. Your account has been created and is now ready for use.

steps.headline: Access your account on the kiosk with your BottleDrop card and your PIN.
steps.description: Print bag labels. The kiosk will print out a set of ten stickers. You will need these labels to use the drop off program.

steps.headline: Go to the customer service desk.
steps.description:
Ask for a pack of "BottleDrop green bags". You must use these green BottleDrop branded bags. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fd\/Greenbags.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fd\/Greenbags.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Purchase a pack of 10 bags for $2 and apply the labels you printed earlier. One bag holds about 90-100 12oz containers.

steps.headline: Gather up redeemable containers into the green bag.
steps.description: You can put anything with "OR 10c" marking in the bag as long as they're not crushed. Even though bottles/cans purchased in other states such as WA, ID, CA are marked "OR 10c". and machines will read them as valid, per policy you're not supposed to claim refund value for out of state containers in Oregon.. Most beverages in metal, plastic, and glass are included except wine, liquor, milk and gallon jugs. If you're not sure, just look for "OR 10c" on the top or the label. There's a weight limit of 20 lbs per bag which only matters if you have a lot of glass bottles. That's about 40 common 12 oz. beer bottles, although BottleDrop claims that the weight limit is equivalent to 30 glass bottle. It's best to start a new bag just for glass then, when you have about 40, fill the rest with aluminum and plastic containers.

steps.headline: Securely close the full bag and attach one of the labels you obtained earlier.
steps.description: Don't overfill the bags. The top of the bag needs to close completely. You lose credit for anything that falls out. Attach only one label per bag. Each label has a unique serial number.

steps.headline: Go back to the redemption center or an express location and locate the drop-off vault.
steps.description:
Most sites are open 7AM to 10PM. It is a good idea to write down the last four digits of the number below the bar code together with the date, time and the location of your drop off since the OBRC/BottleDrop loses bags from time to time. For this reason, it's best to drop off only one bag at a time even though you can drop off 15 bags per any 90 day period in any combination you like..
Do be aware that you maybe shorted. BottleDrop's process is based on technology licensed from a company called CLYNK based in Maine. In response to a viewer complaint,local news station tested the CLYNK system and they were shorted 13%.

steps.headline: Scan your BottleDrop card to open the vault and drop off your bag inside.
steps.description: When possible toss the bag into the vault out of arm's reach to avoid theft and tampering.

steps.headline: Close the door behind you securely.
Wait up to a week to receive credit to your account.
steps.description: If you don't get credited after 7 days, call (503) 542-5252 and complain. It goes smoother when you have the last four of the bag number and date/time of your drop off. Bags dropped off at a stand-alone BottleDrop location tend to get processed faster if you're in a rush. There's a 40 cent fee per bag. So, you will be credited 10 cents for each container minus the 40 cent per bag processing fee, so try to bring the bags full.

steps.headline: Withdraw funds in person at the kiosk.
steps.description: If you're visiting a "Plus" location (usually Fred Meyer and Safeway), you can choose between cash at face value or store credit worth $1.20 for every dollar in your account valid at that store. Practically speaking, using the green bag and selecting the store credit is the only no loss method taking the value of your time into account.

steps.headline: Choose the cash button and take the print out to the cashier if you elect to get cash.
steps.description: You can not cash out the Plus store credit. So only withdraw store credit in the amount you'll spend during that shopping trip.

steps.headline: Create an account for your card.
steps.description: Go to https://www.bottledropcenters.com/ or download BottleDrop Account app to create an account for your card. This is optional, but strongly recommended. You don't have to setup an online account to make use of the drop off service. The account allows you to see your account balance without going to a kiosk and set up a text notification when your bag has been counted or when funds are withdrawn from your account. The account also gives you the option to donate funds to a list of non-profit organizations listed in their website if you're feeling charitable. You must create an online account if you want to make a donation directly to a charity using your account balance.
